src:
Študentki vzeli tablete proti slabosti, obe so našli mrtvi
Skupaj sta se odpravili na potovanje, ki se je končalo tragično.
02 Nov 2019, 17:51 by P. K.



FOTO: Facebook



Britanka Natalie Seymour. FOTO: Facebook


Britanka Natalie Seymour (22) in njena kanadska kolegica Abbey Gail Amisola (27) sta umrli v hostlu na potovanju po Kambodži samo šest dni po tem, ko sta odšli na pot, poroča Mirror. Obe sta imeli simptome zastrupitve s hrano, bilo jima je slabo in sta bruhali. V bližnji lekarni sta kupili tablete proti slabosti, samo nekaj ur po zaužitju tablet pa so obe našli mrtvi. 


Britanka Natalie Seymour. FOTO: Facebook

Policija v Kambodži je preiskala njuno sobo in našla Nataliejin mobilni telefon, na katerem je bilo vidno, da je po spletu iskala simptome njunih težav. V iskalnik je zapisala, da tako močno bruha, da jo boli v prsih, in da so trebušni krči tako močni, da ne ve več, kaj naj stori. Okoli nje je bilo vse pobruhano, šlo je za mešanico krvi in zelene sluzi. Policija je najprej posumila, da sta vzeli preveč tablet, saj so v njuni sobi našli škatlico z manjkajočimi tabletami proti slabosti.Kaj se je v resnici zgodilo, še ni znano, saj izvide obdukcije še čakajo.
text:
Students took pills against nausea, both found dead
Together they set out on a journey that ended tragically.
02 Nov 2019, 17:51 by P.K.



PHOTO: Facebook



British Natalie Seymour. PHOTO: Facebook


Britain's Natalie Seymour, 22, and her Canadian counterpart Abbey Gail Amisola, 27, died at a hostel on a trip to Cambodia just six days after they left for the trip, the Mirror reports. Both had symptoms of food poisoning, were sick and vomited. They bought nausea pills at a nearby pharmacy, and just hours after taking the pills, both were found dead.


British Natalie Seymour. PHOTO: Facebook

Cambodian police searched their room and found Natalie's cellphone, which showed that she had searched the web for symptoms of their problems. She wrote in the search engine that she was vomiting so much that it hurt in her chest and that her abdominal cramps were so intense that she no longer knew what to do. Everything was broken around her, it was a mixture of blood and green slime. Police first suspected they had taken too many pills, as they found a box containing the missing pills in their room for nausea. What really happened is not yet known, as the autopsy results are still pending.
